30.title:  Blondie. Chic Young's Blondie : From Honeymoon to Diapers & Dogs, Complete Daily Comics 1933-1935
30.author: edited and designed by Dean Mullaney; associate editor Bruce Canwell ; art director Lorraine Turner ; introduction by Brian Walker ; production assistance by Joseph Ketels, Jackson Glassey.
notes: (The Library of American Comics)

"This book concludes our two-volume collection that reprints, for the very first time, the earliest Blondie comic strips. Our first volume detailed Blondie and Dagwood's courtship and ended with their momentous wedding. The comics in this book pick up the story with the young couple on their madcap honeymoon followed by their attempts to settle in to a middle class life of married bliss."

58.title:  Blondie
58.author: [No author]
notes: Summary (by Amy Lazet): Dagwood is snacking before bed, but Blondie tells him he will sleep better if he doesn't. Dagwood disagrees, since snacking gives him vivid, colorful dreams. He has a bowl of spaghetti, and dreams of kings and flying and beautiful maidens, until Blondie awakens him in a panic. The alarm never went off! She sends Daisy the dog to wake the children while she hustles Dagwood along. After a frantic flurry of activity, Dagwood and the children leave for work and school. Suddenly, Daisy and Blondie notice the newspaper on the stoop. It's Sunday! "Be brave, Daisy," Blondie murmurs as they clutch each other in nervous apprehension while Dagwood and the kids storm furiously back into the house.

101.series: July 1, 1986) "What Do Three Kings and Two Sixes Mean?"*
notes: Summary: Blondie takes Dagwood's place at poker.

102.title:  Blondie
102.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: Dagwood thinks the place hasn't changed until people pop up with snorkels.

103.title:  Blondie
103.author: Young & Drake.
103.series: Nov. 6, 1986) "With His Looks He Has To Be Faithful"*
notes: Summary: Cora calls Julius "Old Faithful."

104.title:  Blondie
104.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: A penniless beggar tells Blondie and Dagwood how his wife left, his house burned, his car was stolen and he lost his job; then a coin falls out of his pocket.

105.title:  Blondie
105.author: Young & Drake
105.series: Apr. 8, 1987) "Now I Know I Want To See It!"*
105.appears_in: p. 16 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Deciding on a movie to watch, the kids say the critics hated the one in question.

106.title:  Blondie
106.author: Young & Drake.
106.series: July 13, 1987) "Last Year Alone, She Wore Out Three Smoke Alarms"*
notes: Summary: Elmo complains about his mother's cooking.

107.title:  Blondie
107.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: The salesmen is selling flyswatters that give the fly a fighting chance.

108.title:  Blondie
108.author: Young & Drake.
108.series: Aug. 31, 1987) "He Worked at an Airline Counter Explaining About Lost Luggage"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood has the family album out, and is explaining why Uncle Leo is on crutches.

109.title:  Blondie
109.author: Young & Drake.
109.series: Aug. 29, 1987) "Did He Plan It Like This?"*
notes: Summary: Blondie tells Dagwood it's too hot to mow the lawn, sits him in the shade and brings him lemonade.

110.title:  Blondie
110.author: Young & Drake.
110.series: Jan. 21, 1988) "Good Thing He Doesn't Understand Chinese"*
notes: Summary: At the diner, the cook answers each order in the appropriate language: French dip, Spanish omelette, chop suey.

111.title:  Blondie
111.author: Young & Drake.
111.series: Mar. 4, 1988) "For Faster Service Please Back In"*
notes: Summary: Bad flu season, the clinic can't give flu shots fast enough.

112.title:  Blondie
112.author: Young & Drake.
112.series: May 14, 1988) "In Our New Super Luxury Turbo Coupe"*
notes: Summary: The car salesman is looking for the couple who just had a demonstration ride; we see Blondie and Dagwood standing in the showroom leaning back, and Dagwood's hair is on end.

113.title:  Blondie
113.author: Young & Drake.
113.series: June 8, 1988) "I've Decided To Give You Three Out Of Five"*
notes: Summary: The salesman on his doorstep keeps giving Dagwood one more chance to decide to buy his gadget.

114.title:  Blondie
114.author: Young & Drake.
114.series: Aug. 16, 1988) "At My Prices You Can't Afford a Virus"*
notes: Summary: The doctor thinks it's just the common cold.

115.title:  Blondie
115.author: Young & Drake.
115.series: Aug. 20, 1988) "It's Because He Didn't Count One Hole"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood brags that he knocked eight strokes off his average; Herb fills in the details.

116.title:  Blondie
116.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: Tootsie used all her labor-saving devices, then cleaned them all, and then was too tired to eat the dinner.

117.title:  Blondie
117.author: Young & Drake.
117.series: Sept. 10, 1988) "I Lost Four Balls and I Found Seven!"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood had a good day at golf.

118.title:  Blondie
118.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: Lisa is enjoying cooking school.

119.title:  Blondie
119.author: Young & Drake
119.series: Jan. 21, 1989) "That's When They Sent Me Over Here"*
119.appears_in: p. 65 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Elmo asked his mother why she married his father, and it turned out she'd been wondering the same thing.

120.title:  Blondie
120.author: Young & Drake.
120.series: Apr. 6, 1989) "You Can't Even Go In There Unless You've Been Vaccinated"*
notes: Summary: Alexander's messy room is a disgrace, but it's the Taj Mahal compared to Mark's.

121.title:  Blondie
121.author: Young & Drake.
121.series: May 6, 1989) "That's Why I Hired You in the First Place"*
notes: Summary: The golf pro asks Dagwood if he can take a full swing at the ball, but not actually hit it.

122.title:  Blondie
122.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: Daisy comes running apparently to greet Dagwood, but runs right by.

123.title:  Blondie
123.author: Young & Drake.
123.series: Sept. 5, 1989) "The Dinner I Was Heating For Her Is Gone"*
notes: Summary: Blondie asks who fed Daisy. Everybody says they didn't, and then we see Dagwood gargling over a laundry tub.

124.title:  Blondie
124.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: Alexander offers to cut the lawn, but there are eight inches of snow on the ground.

125.title:  Blondie
125.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: The family's having trouble finding time to feed Daisy, so she puts her bowl by Dagwood's face in bed.

126.title:  Blondie
126.author: by Dean Young & Stan Drake.
notes: Summary: A salesman uses flattery.

127.title:  Blondie
127.author: Young & Drake
127.series: May 7, 1990) "You Don't Expect Me to Fix It, Do You?"*
127.appears_in: p. 44 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: The woman in Dagwoods car pool talks on about being treated as an equal, until they get a flat tire.

128.title:  Blondie
128.author: Young & Drake.
128.series: July 21, 1990) "Even I Can Only Be Perfect For About A Week"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood laments a brown spot in his perfect lawn, and Blondie says perfection can't last.

129.title:  Blondie
129.author: Dean Young & Stan Drake.
129.series: July 28, 1990) "If You Hit Your Ball Where You're Supposed To, You Would've Been Home Two Hours Ago"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood feels guilty about spending so much time away from home.

130.title:  Blondie
130.author: Young & Drake.
130.series: Sept. 1, 1990) "That's Exactly How You Look on the Golf Course"*
notes: Summary: Herb sees Dagwood on his hands and knees in his vegetable garden.

131.title:  Blondie
131.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: Dagwood overhears the topic of conversation at a power luncheon Mr. Dithers is having with his competitors.

132.title:  Blondie
132.author: Young & Drake
132.appears_in: p. 42 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Dagwood asks Blondie not to turn the pages of her newspaper so loudly.

133.title:  Blondie
133.author: Young & Drake.
133.series: Jan. 30, 1991) "A Funny Book Always Makes Me Hungry"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood heads for the kitchen, and Blondie comments that Cinderella, Gone with the Wind, and The Godfather made him hungry as well.

134.title:  Blondie
134.author: by Dean Young and Stan Drake
134.series: Feb. 24, 1991) "I'll Go Back in Five Minutes and Try Again"*
134.appears_in: p. 106 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Blondie has a surprising new hairdo. Dagwood screams and she cries every time he sees it.

135.title:  Blondie
135.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: Dagwood asks the salesman at the pet shop how his new item, pet snails, is moving.

136.title:  Blondie
136.author: Young & Drake.
136.series: Mar. 21, 1991) "Just as I Thought, it's a Cookbook"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood finds the book he's reading in bed to be inspiring and suggestive, and Blondie takes a look at it.

137.title:  Blondie
137.author: Young & Drake
137.appears_in: p. 5 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Blondie's not speaking to Dagwood until he admits he was wrong.

138.title:  Blondie
138.author: by Dean Young & Stan Drake
138.series: Mar. 31, 1991) "Two Pounds of Butter and a Can of Peas"*
138.appears_in: p. 104 in Battered Husbands (Redondo Beach, CA : H. Gregory Associates, 1991).
notes: Summary: Dagwood goes to the store chanting his shopping list: A loaf of bread and two dozen eggs. Just outside the store he is distracted when a woman's skirt is blown up by the wind.

139.title:  Blondie
139.author: Young & Drake.
139.series: Apr. 5, 1991) "Think of What I Could Do with a Dozen Pantries"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood sees a chateau on television that has a dozen pantries.

140.title:  Blondie
140.author: Young & Drake.
140.series: Apr. 30, 1991) "I Think of Work and You Think of Play! That's Why I'm the Boss and You're Not!"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood proposes a game of golf, and Mr. Dithers does it without him.

141.title:  Blondie
141.author: Young & Drake.
141.series: July 20, 1991) "A Man Needs to Get Outside and Dig Into the Earth"*
notes: Summary: A beautiful day. Blondie thinks Dagwood's talking about gardening, but he has golf in mind.

142.title:  Blondie
142.author: Young & Drake.
142.series: Aug. 26, 1991) "You Could've Played a Lot Worse"*
notes: Summary: Blondie tries to get Dagwood to look on the bright side.

143.title:  Blondie
143.author: Young & Drake.
143.series: Aug. 27, 1991) "I Guess We Were Both Right"*
notes: Summary: At the diner, the owner and the cook argue about whether Dagwood will like something, and upon trying it, Dagwood smiles, then runs.

144.title:  Blondie
144.author: by Dean Young & Stan Drake.
144.series: Sept. 14, 1991) "Would You Mind Sharing It with the Rest of the City?"*
notes: Summary: Blondie asks Dagwood about her cooking, and he compares it with her kissing.

145.title:  Blondie
145.author: by Dean Young & Stan Drake.
145.series: Sept. 25, 1991) "I Feel Honored That You Come Here for Lunch"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood is at the lunch counter saying what a great cook Blondie the caterer is.

146.title:  Blondie
146.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: Blondie remarks how easy it seems to cook for her family after catering fancy dinners, and Dagwood asks what's for dinner.

147.title:  Blondie
147.author: by Dean Young and Stan Drake.
147.series: Oct. 26, 1991) "I've Been Playing Golf for 40 Years"*
notes: Summary: Julius Dithers has been playing for 60 years actually, and exaggerates his scores similarly downward.

148.title:  Blondie
148.author: by Dean Young & Stan Drake.
148.series: Jan. 4, 1992) "You Shouldn't Eat Peanuts Right After Dinner!"*
notes: Summary: Blondie gives Dagwood a lecture on nutrition. Blondie has gained weight, Dagwood hasn't.

149.title:  Blondie
149.author: by Dean Young and Stan Drake.
notes: Summary: Cookie meets Dagwood at the door saying he needs to say something to Blondie to "restore her faith as a cook."

150.title:  Blondie
150.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: The pet shop owner says it may be a Chinese Wooly-Haired Chowhound, or a Scotish Bairn-Bottomed Sheep Spaniel.

151.title:  Blondie
151.author: Young & Drake.
151.series: June 20, 1992) "You Should See Me Walk 18 Holes"*
notes: Summary: The mailman doesn't play golf, but he does walk.

152.title:  Blondie
152.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: Dagwood forgets to count the dog when he responds to the man at the door (a census of some kind?) with the clipboard; Daisy's crestfallen.

153.title:  Blondie
153.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: Mr. Dithers never looks at his ball before they start, so he doesn't know if the one behind the tree is his.

154.title:  Blondie
154.author: Young and Drake.
154.series: July 20, 1992) "I Wonder How It Came to be Called Dog Days?"*
notes: Summary: The mailman Mr. Beasley says this is the worst part of the summer, and shows the shredded seat of his pants as his reason.

155.title:  Blondie
155.author: Young & Drake.
155.series: Aug. 11, 1992) "From Now On, I'm Going to Cultivate Weeds and I'll Pull Out Any Grass that Grows"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood tells Blondie his new idea for the lawn, and she puts him in a hammock with lemonade.

156.title:  Blondie
156.author: Young & Drake.
156.series: Sept. 25, 1992) "He Always Buys Too Much Food"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood comes home with Chinese carry-out on two long poles over his shoulders.

157.title:  Blondie
157.author: Young & Drake.
157.series: Oct. 10, 1992) "This Has to be the Nuttiest Neighborhood in the World!"*
notes: Summary: Daisy is barking at another dog walking by, and Dagwood shows her how silly it would be if humans barked at human pedestrians.

158.title:  Blondie
158.author: by Dean Young & Stan Drake.
158.series: Dec. 29, 1992) "All He Needs is Just One Speed"*
notes: Summary: Elmo is whooshing back and forth on his new Christmas ten-speed.

159.title:  Blondie
159.author: Young & Drake.
159.series: Jan. 9, 1993) "The Biggest Display of International Cuisine Ever Assembled in One Place!*
notes: Summary: Dagwood decides to go to a catering conference with Blondie.

160.title:  Blondie
160.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: Betsey's a new grandmother, and her daughter used her own version of natural childbirth.

161.title:  Blondie
161.author: Young & Drake.
161.series: Feb. 2, 1993) "I Wonder Why There Are So Many Parking Spaces?"*
notes: Summary: Blondie and Dagwood park, then see a snowplow cover their car with snow.

162.title:  Blondie
162.author: by Dean Young & Stan Drake.
162.series: Feb. 4, 1993) "What Have I Just Been Telling You?"*
notes: Summary: Mr. Dithers takes Dagwood to lunch, first making him promise not to talk about politics or sports or anything to upset the peace. So Dagwood asks, "How's Cora?"

163.title:  Blondie
163.author: by Dean Young & Stan Drake.
163.series: May 8, 1993) "We Don't Spend Enough Time Together"*
notes: Summary: Alexander wants to be with his dad, so Dagwood borrows a second lawmmower and they mow the yard together.

164.title:  Blondie
164.author: Young & Drake.
164.series: June 1, 1993) "I'm Taking Cooking Classes from a World-Famous Chef"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood still thinks the soup tastes like dishwater.

165.title:  Blondie
165.author: Young & Drake.
165.series: July 31, 1993) "Wait'll He Sees the New Numbers on his Paycheck!"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood insists on arguing about the boss's score, because he's good with numbers.

166.title:  Blondie
166.author: Young & Drake.
166.series: Sept. 3, 1991) "Neither of You Left the 17th Century"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood says he'd never allow Blondie to have a job, and a woman in his car pool says he reminds her of Shakespeare.

167.title:  Blondie
167.author: by Dean Young & Stan Drake.
167.series: Oct. 8, 1993) "I'll Bet You Money Shakespeare Had the Very Same Note in His Pocket"*
notes: Summary: Elmo doesn't think Dagwood's notes to himself about errands are very great thoughts.

168.title:  Blondie
168.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: Dagwood's making fried rice and Blondie approves, though she doesn't know that the seasonings include sausage, meatballs, shrimp, chicken and pastrami.

169.title:  Blondie
169.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: The Feathered Friend Society of birdwatchers is finicky eaters, and Dagwood has an unwelcome suggestion for their catered dinner.

170.title:  Blondie
170.author: Young & Drake.
170.series: June 21, 1994) "I Have to Work on the McNutley Contract"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood asks the boss to be a fourth for golf on Saturday, and ends up working while the boss plays.

171.title:  Blondie
171.author: by Dean Young and Stan Drake.
171.series: June 25, 1994) "Once He Starts a Thing He Keeps On Doing It"*
notes: Summary: Blondie interrupts Dagwood's lawnmowing for some lemonade, and he never gets back to the lawn.

172.title:  Blondie
172.author: by Dean Young and Stan Drake.
172.series: Sept. 24, 1994) "It's the Only Time All Week I Feel Superior to Anybody"*
notes: Summary: A round takes forever, but Herb likes playing with Mr. Dithers, who takes five or six putts every green and sends half his drives into the woods.

173.title:  Blondie
173.author: by Dean Young and Stan Drake
173.appears_in: reproduced on p. 143 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Mr. Dithers needs Dagwood to work on Sunday, and Dagwood doesn't want to disappoint the rest of his foursome for golf.

175.title:  Blondie
175.author: Young & Drake.
175.series: June 17, 1995) "This Is Ridiculous! I Don't Even Play Golf"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood rushes the mailman off off to the big golf sale at Tudbury's.

176.title:  Blondie
176.author: Young & Drake.
176.series: Aug. 26, 1995) "If I Lie Down In My Hammock, She'll Find Some Work For Me"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood starts mowing the lawn when it's too hot out, and Blondie makes him quit and lie in his hammock.

177.title:  Blondie
177.author: Young & Drake.
notes: Summary: A letter to the advice column is about a woman who cooks well, yet her husband makes himself big snacks. Blondie reads the letter to Dagwood.

178.title:  Blondie
178.author: Young & Drake.
178.series: Mar. 25, 1996) "Business May Be Slow, but at Least We're Eating Well"*
notes: Summary: Blondie and Tootsie are cooking rib roast, turkey, stuffed potatoes, creamed onions, corn pudding, cakes, and pies.

179.title:  Blondie
179.author: Young & Drake.
179.series: Aug. 24, 1996) "Oh Well, It's the Thought That Counts"*
notes: Summary: Alexander thinks about surprising Dad by mowing the lawn, but then meets Lisa at the Burger Den instead.

180.title:  Blondie
180.author: Young & Lebrun.
180.series: June 6, 1997) "Surf and Turf in That Place must be Sardines and Salami!"*
notes: Summary: Mr. Dithers insults the lunch counter where Dagwood usually eats.

181.title:  Blondie
181.author: Young & LeBrun.
181.series: June 30, 1997) "I Just Got to the Part about Chopping Onions"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood is reading in bed and crying. Blondie asks if he's reading a love story, but it's a cookbook.

182.title:  Blondie
182.author: Young & LeBrun.
182.series: July 11, 1997) "Why Didn't You Tell Him It Was Your Bike?"*
notes: Summary: A bully has taken Elmo's bike.

183.title:  Blondie
183.author: Young & Lebrun.
notes: Summary: In bed with Blondie, Dagwood describes the nicest part of his day in terms of hugs and flowers, then remembers the pork chops.
Key word: Bedrooms.

184.title:  Blondie
184.author: Young & Lebrun.
notes: Summary: Dagwood is exasperated that the kids' vocabulary seems to be reduced to the word 'cool;' Blondie thinks he's exaggerating.
Key words: Hot weather.

185.title:  Blondie
185.author: Young & LeBrun.
notes: Summary: Dagwood wants to tell off Mr. Dithers, but the words won't come out.
Key words: Bosses, employees, offices.

186.title:  Blondie
186.author: Young and LeBrun.
notes: Summary: Dagwood doesn't want any bills during his vacation, even though he's staying home.
Key word: Mailmen.

187.title:  Blondie
187.author: Young and LeBrun.
notes: Summary: Dagwood waits to find out if the dress is on sale before he says whether he likes it.
Key word: Salesladies.

188.title:  Blondie
188.author: Young and LeBrun.
notes: Summary: A mind-reader comes to Dagwood's door, and leaves without making a sale.
Key words: Salesmen, insults, doorsteps.

189.title:  Blondie
189.author: Young & LeBrun.
189.series: Nov. 1, 1997) "I've Got That Now, and I Don't Have to Travel"*
notes: Summary: Mr. Dithers doesn't see what would be so good about being a pro golfer and having a life of country clubs, money, and people catering to his whims.

190.title:  Blondie
190.author: Young & LeBrun.
190.series: Nov. 15, 1997) "The Way You Hit a Golf Ball You Could Play 18 Holes Indoors"*
notes: Summary: Herb doesn't think Dagwood should care that winter's coming.
Callno.: PN6726 f.B55 "golf"

191.title:  Blondie
191.author: Young and LeBrun.
notes: Summary: Dagwood calls for technical support for his computer, and is comforted to hear a human voice; he's talking to Dogbert of the Dilbert strip.

192.title:  Blondie
192.author: Young & LeBrun.
192.series: May 23, 1998) "Did You See a Golf Ball Come Over Into Your Your Yard"*
notes: Summary: Soon after Dagwood asks, the ball hits Herb on the head.

193.title:  Blondie
193.author: Young & LeBrun.
notes: Summary: A golf ball lands in Dagwood's yard from 10 houses away.

194.title:  Blondie
194.author: Young & LeBrun.
194.series: June 20, 1998) "I Told Her Twice, But She Didn't Answer"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood has this idea about making the backyard into a putting green.

195.title:  Blondie
195.author: Young & LeBrun.
195.series: June 24, 1998) "When You Get Back to the Office, Tell Them I've Gone to the Golf Course"*
notes: Summary: Mr. Dithers agrees that it's too nice a day to work.

196.title:  Blondie
196.author: by Dean Young and Denis Lebrun.
196.series: July 15, 1998) "If My Letter is Rated 'G' Would They Read It?"*
notes: Summary: The movie industry thinks people won't watch movies without bad language, and Cookie thinks about writing a letter to complain.

197.title:  Blondie
197.author: Young & LeBrun.
197.series: July 20, 1998) "Sure! Justin Can Come Over to Dinner"*
notes: Summary: Cookie wants to bring Justin to dinner, because his parents are out of town. Either that or she'll go cook for Justin at his house.

198.title:  Blondie
198.author: Young & LeBrun.
198.series: July 23, 1998) "How Do Two-Wheel Bikes Stay Up?"*
notes: Summary: Elmo asks Dagwood to explain, and he can't.

199.title:  Blondie
199.author: Young & LeBrun.
199.series: Nov. 7, 1998) "I Insist on Ending the Year with a Good Round"*

200.title:  Blondie
200.author: by Dean Young and Denis Lebrun.
200.series: Aug. 3, 1999) "After Our Wedding, Courtney and I are Going to Move In With You and Mom, and in Return, I'll Cut the Grass"*
notes: Summary: Alexander contemplates property taxes, medical insurance, and homeowner's insurance.

201.title:  Blondie
201.author: Young & LeBrun.
201.series: Aug. 14, 1999) "Can I Cut Your Grass for Fifty Dollars?"*
notes: Summary: Elmo has his eye on a skateboard, and wants to earn the money for it all at once.

202.title:  Blondie
202.author: Young & LeBrun.
202.series: Aug. 20, 1999) "Everybody was so Fussy About the Way They Wanted Their Hamburgers Cooked"*
notes: Summary: Alexander comes home complaining about his day.

203.title:  Blondie
203.author: by Young & LeBrun.
203.series: Aug. 21, 1999) "I'd Much Rather Finish Weeding than Play Poker!"*
notes: Summary: Herb invites Dagwood, and Dagwood thinks Blondie's listening.

204.title:  Blondie
204.author: Young & LeBrun.
204.series: Sept. 4, 1999) "We Aren't Allowed to Ride it Through the Parking Lot to the Car"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood says golf is great exercise, and Blondie asks how if they just ride in the golf cart.

205.title:  Blondie
205.author: Young & Lebrun.
205.series: Feb. 16, 2000) "Did the Boss Give You Time to Talk About Your Raise?"*
notes: Summary: They had a four-word conversation.

206.title:  Blondie
206.author: Young & LeBrun.
206.series: Feb. 25, 2000) "My Other Job is at the Library"*
notes: Summary: At a basketball game, the usher tells Dagwood to be quiet, then apologizes.

207.title:  Blondie
207.author: Young & LeBrun.
notes: Summary: Blondie helps Dagwood remember their first date.

208.title:  Blondie
208.author: Young & LeBrun.
208.series: July 12, 2000) "He's a Little Weak in the Dependability Department"*
notes: Summary: The cook quits while Dagwood is asking the owner of the diner how he's doing on his first day at work.

209.title:  Blondie
209.author: Young & LeBrun.
209.series: Oct. 7, 2000) "It's My Turn and I've Got Nothing to Lose"*
notes: Summary: Herb proposes flipping a coin to see who trims the hedge.

210.title:  Blondie
210.author: by Dean Young and Denis Lebrun.
notes: Summary: Four very short men are looking for a job at the lunch counter.

211.title:  Blondie
211.author: Young & LeBrun.
211.series: Dec. 25, 2000) "So Why Would You Give Me a Putter?"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood and Herb interpret each other's Christmas gifts as criticism of their respective golf games.

212.title:  Blondie
212.author: by Dean Young and Denis LeBrun.
212.series: June 12, 2001) "Nobody Ever Shows Up 'Til Afternoon Anyway"*
notes: Summary: Blondie's catering a breakfast for the Procrastinator's Club this morning, but there's no hurry.

213.title:  Blondie
213.author: Young & LeBrun.
213.series: July 7, 2001) "Last Weekend You Played Golf in a Downpour"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood's not going to mow the lawn because it's sprinkling out.

214.title:  Blondie
214.author: Young and LeBrun.
214.series: July 14, 2001) "Mr. B., Can You Actually Cook Anything Beside Sandwiches?"*
notes: Summary: Elmo keeps asking about Dagwood's cooking until it's clear that sandwiches and barbecuing are the extent of it.

215.title:  Blondie
215.author: Young & Lebrun.
215.series: Oct. 9, 2001) "Don't Toy With Me If You Aren't Serious"*
notes: Summary: Dagwood has to sign a release to get chili.
